item.title: Access the Internet from evaluation boards via PC
item.author: hfwang132
item.description: Windows Set a network adapter that can access the internet in the Control Panel and share it with Ethernet. The IP address of Ethernet will change to 192.168.137.1 (this is the default behavior in Windows). Then, set the gateway as 192.168.137.1 in the terminal of the development board: sudo route add default gw 192.168.137.1 Set the IP address as 192.168.137.x, where x is any value except 1 and 255 (gateway address and broadcast address):

item.title: Increasing the swapfile for Linux
item.author: hfwang132
item.description: Xilinx’s toolchain consumes soooo much memory! Sometimes it causes the system to freeze… After all, my laptop only has 8GB of RAM. So there’s no other choice but to add virtual memories. After increase the swapfile, the system performance has improved a lot: 1 2 3 4 sudo swapoff /swapfile sudo dd if=/dev/zero of=/swapfile bs=1M count=16384 sudo mkswap /swapfile sudo swapon /swapfile

item.title: Partitioning and Formatting SD Cards with Linux
item.author: hfwang132
item.description: To partition and format an SD card in Linux, follow these steps: First, connect the SD card to your PC. Then, use the fdisk command in the bash command line to partition the SD card. Finally, use the mkfs command to create a file system (format) on the SD card. The main commands are as follows: First, use sudo fdisk -l to confirm which device in /dev corresponds to the SD card.

item.title: Mounting the EFI partition in Windows OS
item.author: hfwang132
item.description: To mount the EFI partitions, run the following commands in PowerShell: 1 2 3 4 5 6 diskpart list disk # make sure which is the disk that contains the EFI partition. usually 0 select disk 0 list partition # make sure which is the EFI partition. normally 0 select disk 0 assign letter=z Then we will mount the EFI partition as drive Z. This operation may be useful when using a dual-boot system with Windows and Ubuntu: Sometimes, after removing the Ubuntu system, only the Windows system remains, but the GRUB interface still appears every time the computer boots.
